title: 1983-F
statement: F. array-valuetime limit per test4 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou have an array of non-negative integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$.The value of a sub-array of length $$$\\ge 2$$$, $$$a[l, r] = [a_l, a_{l+1}, \\ldots, a_r]$$$ is the minimum value of $$$a_i \\oplus a_j$$$ such that $$$l \\le i < j \\le r$$$, where $$$\\oplus$$$ is the xor (exclusive-or) operator.You have to find the $$$k$$$-th smallest value over all sub-arrays of length $$$\\ge 2$$$.InputThe first line of the input contains multiple test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 2 \\cdot 10^4$$$).The first line of each test case contains integer numbers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 10^5$$$, $$$1 \\le k \\le \\frac{n\\cdot(n-1)}{2}$$$).The second line of the input contains $$$n$$$ non-negative integer numbers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$0 \\le a_i \\le 10^9$$$) â€” the array itself.It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$10^5$$$.OutputPrint the $$$k$$$-th smallest value obtained over all subarrays of length at least $$$2$$$.ExampleInput45 21 2 3 4 52 14 34 61 2 4 85 91 2 3 4 5Output1 7 12 3NoteIn the first testcase, we have subarrays with their smallest exclusive-or pair as:$$$[1,2]: 3$$$$$$[2,3]: 1$$$$$$[3,4]: 7$$$$$$[4,5]: 1$$$$$$[1,2,3]: 1$$$$$$[2,3,4]: 1$$$$$$[3,4,5]: 1$$$$$$[1,2,3,4]: 1$$$$$$[2,3,4,5]: 1$$$$$$[1,2,3,4,5]: 1$$$The sorted order would be: $$$1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 3, 7$$$. Therefore, the second smallest element would be $$$1$$$.

processed.result: You are given a list of numbers. Find the k-th smallest result you can get by taking two numbers from the list and using the XOR operation on them.

You are given an array of non-negative integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$.  For each subarray of length at least 2, find the minimum value obtained by taking the bitwise XOR of any two elements in the subarray.  Your task is to find the $k$-th smallest of these minimum values.

Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains two integers, $n$ (the length of the array) and $k$ (the desired rank of the minimum value).
    * The second line contains $n$ non-negative integers, the elements of the array.

Output:

* For each test case, print the $k$-th smallest minimum XOR value.
